subtasks: Gather necessary materials (hoe, urine, EM, 20 kg rich soil, 20 kg dried manure, 20 kg biochar)
Prepare a flat, hard surface and cover it with plastic
Empty biochar bags onto plastic in center
Apply urine over biochar, ensuring it's wet thoroughly
Add more urine, repeating the wetting process
Top the pile with soil and add more urine
Begin mixing ingredients to distribute moisture and combine components
Continue mixing until the pile no longer absorbs urine, ensuring maximum moisture retention
Sprinkle EM solution over the mix while continuing to remix
Cover the finished mix to protect from rain
Create a trench around the mix for better protection

tasks.task: Waiting for the fertilizer to mature
subtasks: Allow three months for the biochar fertilizer to mature and develop efficacy
Introduce the matured biochar fertilizer into soil around crops
Mix the biochar into the soil at the roots of the plants

tasks.task: Understanding the benefits of biochar fertilizer
subtasks: Recognizing the high nutrient content (nitrogen, potassium, phosphorus) from urine and manure
Appreciating the restoration of natural soil fertility
Noting the ability of biochar to trap pesticide residues, reducing contamination of produce
